item.title: Roof Shade - Overview
item.description: Project Overview A lot of work into these roof shades… this is a many part series

item.title: Auto Roller Shade
item.description: We like to open and close the shades more now that we can ask Alexa to do it. THE END RESULT PARTS LIST Key bits that makes this work: The motor with a radio - Somfy Roll Up Wirefree R28 RTS Motor The motor radio to z-wave thing - Somfy ZRTSI RTS 16 Channel Z-Wave to RTS Plug-in Interface Wall Module Wink Hub - The z-wave thing to internet thing An Alexa Device - Echo Dot IFTTT There are also some other little bits that are needed, but are less exciting:

item.title: Drivetrain
item.description: Project Overview race car project for credit

item.title: Uprights
item.description: Project Overview This was a project for race car team. I designed, analyzed, and fabricated the uprights for the car. Project Goal

item.title: CMR 57 Body
item.description: Project Overview Trials and tribulations of sketch to finished carbon car body for Carnegie Mellon Racing’s #57 car.

item.title: Monkey Bot
item.description: Project Overview A robot that was supposed to be able to swing dynamically from monkey bars.

item.title: Vibratron
item.description: Project Overview Built out of a Vibraphone, Vibratron played was a robotic instrument that used recirculating ball bearings to hit keys on a circularly re-constructed vibraphone. This instrument was part of the Robotics club RobOrchestra. Team Members Andrew Burks! Contributions Aesthetic Design The distributor The lift

item.title: HyLo
item.description: Project Overview A robot that has legs and wheels! Hybrid Locomotion

item.title: Soft Arm
item.description: Project Overview The Humanoids Lab and the Quality of Life Technologies group and Carnegie Mellon formed a project whose goal was to create an inherently safe robot that was able to do useful work. This work was presented at the EBMC 2011 conference with the paper, Physical Human Interaction for an Inflatable Manipulator It also turned out to be the inspiration for Baymax of Big Hero 6!

item.title: Soft Wrist and Gripper
item.description: Project Overview A wrist actuated by tendons to move around an inflatable grasper. Provisionally patented!

item.title: Mobot
item.description: Project Overview Mobot is an annual activity at CMU. As a freshman, I wanted to enter into the competition, so joined forces with some savvy electronics and software folks to put together a car. I put the chassis of the beast together and did all the integration with wheels, sensors and compute. We didn’t do too well, but it was a fun start to robot building in Robotics Club! Team Members Jitu Das Harrison Rose Project Goal develop a robot using parts literally off the shelf (megashelf!
